entries.text: TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO ENGINE CONTROLS, DO NOT MOVE THE POWER LEVER AFT OF THE IDLE GATE WITH ENGINE NOT RUNNING.
If oil pressure does not rise or NG does not reach minimum speed:
If NG stabilizes below 51% or ITT at idle approaches 750Â°C:
(1500 RPM, prior to flight into icing conditions)
Flaps T/O: 110 KIAS (Normal Mode), 122-133 KIAS (Pusher Ice Mode)
If in range of landing site:
If cabin altitude exceeds 14,000 ft and passenger masks do not automatically deploy:
DEPENDING ON AIRFIELD CONDITIONS, AND AIRPLANE WEIGHT AND CONFIGURATION, THE AVAILABLE POWER MAY NOT BE SUFFICIENT TO ENSURE A GO-AROUND.
TOTAL LANDING DISTANCE WILL BE INCREASED WITHOUT THE USE OF GROUND-FINE.
WHEN MAN OVRD LEVER IS IN OPERATION, DO NOT PERMIT NG TO FALL BELOW 75%, AVOID RAPID CONTROL MOVEMEMENTS, AND OBSERVE ENGINE LIMITATIONS.
IF SIGNIFICANT TURBULENCE IS EXPECTED, OR IF SUSPECTED STRUCTURAL PROBLEM, DO NOT DESCEND AT INDICATED AIRSPEEDS GREATER THAN VO.
IF ENGINE RELIGHTS AND AFTER NG GREATER THAN 51%
DO NOT ATTEMPT MORE THAN ONE AIR START. REPEATED ATTEMPTS COULD DISCHARGE THE BATTERIES TO LEVELS THAT WOULD NOT SUPPORT ESSENTIAL ELECTRICAL SERVICES.
AFTER AN AIR START, THE AUTOMATIC FUEL SELECTOR HAS BEEN DISABLED, AND THE FUEL SELECTOR MUST BE MANAGED MANUALLY.
AFTER AN ENGINE FIRE IN FLIGHT, DO NOT ATTEMPT AN AIR START.
If cabin altitude exceeds 14,000 ft and passenger masks do not automatically deploy:
Fly by reference to Standby Instrument.
Initiate descent to 10,000 ft or minimum safe altitude (if higher).
If smoke or fumes are present or essential electrical equipment is required:
If smoke and/or fumes are present:
Landing Gear will not extend normally, plan for extending landing gear using Emergency Landing Gear Extension.
Flaps will not extend or retract, plan on landing with flaps in current position.
ALLOW FOR LANDING DISTANCE INCREASE OF UP TO 65% MORE THAN FLAPS FULL.
Initiate descent to 10,000 ft or minimum safe altitude (if higher).
If smoke/fumes are coming from pressurization air:
If smoke/fumes are coming from pressurization air:
USE OF DEFROST TOGETHER WITH EMERG PRESS IS PROHIBITED.

entries.response: FLAPS UP: 110 KIAS, FLAPS T/O: 105 KIAS, FLAPS FULL: 95 KIAS

entries.text: If able, have ground personnel visually verify gear position.

entries.response: AS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SPEED AND 300 TO 500 FPM DESCENT

entries.text: Ditch with low rate of descent.
IN HEAVY SWELL WITH LIGHT WIND, LAND PARALLEL TO THE SWELL.
IN HEAVY WIND, LAND INTO THE WIND, TOUCHING DOWN AT THE TOP OF OR ON THE BACKSIDE OF A SWELL, IF POSSIBLE.
If the shaker is active and the AoA indicator is in the red arc (greater than 0.8):
If the shaker is still active:
If the shaker is active and the AoA indicator is NOT in the red arc (less than 0.8):
If the shaker is still active:
WITH THE STALL PREVENTION SYSTEM INOPERATIVE, DO NOT DECELERATE BELOW THE AIRSPEEDS IN THE MINIMUM SPEEDS TABLE.
DISABLING BOTH SPS COMPUTERS WILL CAUSE PUSHER ICE MODE TO BE DISPLAYED, AND WHEN ICE PROTECTION SYSTEMS ARE OFF, AN ADDITIONAL ICE MODE FAIL CAUTION WILL BE DISPLAYED.
If going around, and after shaker deactivates:
WITH THE STALL PREVENTION SYSTEM INOPERATIVE, DO NOT DECELERATE BELOW THE AIRSPEEDS IN THE MINIMUM SPEEDS TABLE.
HOLD THE CONTROL YOKE FIRMLY. UP TO 50 POUNDS OF FORCE ON THE CONTROL YOKE MAY BE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN LEVEL FLIGHT.
Notify ATC of loss of RVSM capability.
If yaw damper is still controlling the airplane:
HOLD THE CONTROL YOKE FIRMLY. SIGNIFICANT FORCE ON THE CONTROL YOKE MAY BE REQUIRED.

entries.response: SET BY REFERENCE TO ATTITUDE AND AIRSPEED

entries.text: WHEN FULLY CHARGED, THE INTERNAL BATTERY IN THE STANDBY INSTRUMENT WILL PROVIDE POWER FOR AT LEAST 60 MINUTES IF AIRPLANE POWER IS LOST.
Landing Gear will not extend normally, plan for extending landing gear using Emergency Landing Gear Extension.
Flaps will not extend or retract, plan on landing with flaps in current position.

entries.response: FLAPS UP: 115 KIAS, FLAPS T/O: 110 KIAS, FLAPS FULL: 95 KIAS

entries.text: IF LANDING WITH ICE ACCRETIONS ON THE AIRPLANE FINAL APPROACH AIRSPEEDS ARE 122 - 133 KIAS FLAPS UP AND 119 - 130 KIAS FLAPS T/O.
IF LANDING WITH FLAPS UP, ALLOW FOR LANDING DISTANCE INCREASE OF UP TO 65% MORE THAN FLAPS FULL.

checklists.name: AIR DATA AND ATTITUDE HEADING REFERENCE SYSTEM (ADAHRS) FAILURE

entries.text: Notify ATC of loss of RVSM capability.
Refer to working airspeed indicating system (other PFD and/or standby instrument).
Notify ATC of loss of RVSM capability.
If all airspeed indicating systems have failed and symptoms persist:
Perform a precautionary landing, flying by reference to attitude, altitude, and power instruments.
Refer to working altitude indicating system (other PFD and/or standby instrument).
Notify ATC of loss of RVSM capability.
If all altitude indicating systems have failed and symptoms persist:
Refer to GNSS altitude (MFD Map TAWS-B Page).

checklists.name: AUTOPILOT UNABLE TO MAINTAIN ASSIGNED FLIGHT LEVEL ±65 FEET DURING RVSM OPERATIONS

entries.text: If autopilot is unable to maintain assigned flight level ±65 feet:
Evaluate the ability to maintain altitude through manual control.
Notify ATC of the failure and await ATC instructions.
IF TIME PERMITS, BEFORE USING OXYGEN, REMOVE ANY POTENTIALLY FLAMMABLE SUBSTANCES FROM YOUR FACE (OILS, GREASE, SOAP, LIPSTICK, MAKEUP, ETC.).

checklists.name: CRACKED OR DELAMINATED WINDSHIELD OR WINDOW IN FLIGHT

entries.text: Descend to 10,000 ft or minimum safe altitude (if higher).

checklists.name: EXITING SEVERE ICING OR SLD CONDITIONS

entries.text: Exit the area immediately by changing altitude and/or course.
Do not re-engage the autopilot until the airframe is clear of ice.

If an unusual roll response or uncommanded control movement is observed, reduce angle of attack by increasing airspeed and/or rolling wings level (if in a turn), and apply additional power, if needed.
Avoid extending flaps during extended operations in icing conditions to reduce the possibility of ice forming on the upper surface of the wing further aft than normal.
If flaps are extended, do not retract them until the airframe is clear of ice.
Report these weather conditions to Air Traffic Control.
To acknowledge and silence EDM alert:
Reduce power and immediately begin a descent to 10,000 ft or minimum safe altitude (if higher).
If cabin altitude is rising rapidly accelerate to VMO/MMO to maximize descent rate.
IF SIGNIFICANT TURBULENCE IS EXPECTED, OR IF SUSPECTED STRUCTURAL PROBLEM, DO NOT DESCEND AT INDICATED AIRSPEEDS GREATER THAN VO.
If cabin altitude remains at or above 10,000 ft:

entries.response: CHECK, RESET ONE TIME IF OPEN

entries.text: If cabin altitude remains at or above 10,000 ft:

entries.response: CHECK, RESET ONE TIME IF OPEN

entries.text: USE OF DEFROST TOGETHER WITH EMERG PRESS IS PROHIBITED
Perform LANDING GEAR FAILS TO EXTEND (3A.4.2).

entries.response: VERIFY POWER IS ABOVE DE-ICE BOOTS TORQUE LIMITATION: UP TO 10,000 ft: 15% TRQ, ABOVE 10,000 ft: 35% TRQ

entries.text: If DE-ICE FAIL Warning persists or returns:

A LEAKING DE-ICE BOOTS SYSTEM MAY COMPROMISE THE LEADING EDGE OF THE WINGS OR HORIZONTAL STABILIZER. LEAVE THE PROP HEAT SWITCH ON TO REMAIN IN PUSHER ICE MODE AND LAND WITH THE FLAPS IN THE T/O POSITION.
If oil temperature exceeds 90°C and is rising:

entries.response: Flaps UP: 122 – 133 KIAS, Flaps T/O: 119 – 130 KIAS

entries.text: DO NOT ADJUST THE POSITION OF DOOR HANDLES IN FLIGHT.
Descend to 10,000 ft or minimum safe altitude (if higher).

entries.response: REDUCE TO MINIMUM REQUIRED FOR SAFE FLIGHT

entries.text: If generator amperage is zero or less:
If GEN FAIL Warning does not extinguish:

entries.response: REDUCE BELOW 850°C AND ITT HIGH WARNING EXTINGUISHES OR MINIMUM POWER FOR SAFE FLIGHT

entries.text: Land as soon as possible, using minimum power.
HIGH ITT AT INTERMEDIATE POWER SETTINGS MAY BE AN EARLY INDICATION OF IMPENDING ENGINE FAILURE.

entries.response: REDUCE BELOW 104% AND NG HIGH WARNING EXTINGUISHES OR MINIMUM POWER FOR SAFE FLIGHT

entries.text: Land as soon as possible, using minimum power.
HIGH NG AT INTERMEDIATE POWER SETTINGS MAY BE AN EARLY INDICATION OF IMPENDING ENGINE FAILURE.
If NP not under control of PROP Lever:
IF NP REMAINS BETWEEN 1730 AND 1802 RPM:
OIL PRESSURES UNDER 60 PSI MAY BE AN EARLY INDICATION OF IMPENDING ENGINE FAILURE.
If OIL TEMP HIGH Warning remains:
OIL TEMPERATURES ABOVE 110°C ARE UNSAFE AND MAY LEAD TO A LOSS OF OIL PRESSURE AND/OR ENGINE FAILURE.
IF IN ICING CONDITIONS OR IF RESIDUAL ICE REMAINS ON THE AIRFRAME:
IF NOT IN ICING CONDITIONS AND NO RESIDUAL ICE ON THE AIRFRAME:
LANDING WITH NORMAL APPROACH AIRSPEEDS WHILE IN PUSHER ICE MODE MAY CAUSE AN ERRONEOUS PUSH DURING THE LANDING FLARE.
IF RUDDER TRAVEL IS NOT LIMITED:
Do not apply large left rudder input with torque above 20%.
Select a runway with minimum crosswind.
MAXIMUM RIGHT CROSSWIND IS 10 KNOTS. STEERING DURING LANDING ROLLOUT WILL BE REDUCED.

entries.response: REDUCE UNTIL TORQUE BELOW 100% OR MINIMUM SAFE POWER

entries.text: Land as soon as possible, using minimum power.

entries.response: SMOOTHLY INCREASE AS REQUIRED TO CORRECT UNDERSPEED CONDITION

entries.text: RAPID POWER APPLICATION TO A HIGH POWER SETTING MAY RESULT IN PITCH ATTITUDES UP TO 20 DEGREES NOSE UP DURING RECOVERY FROM UNDERSPEED PROTECTION.
If WSH HEAT ON Warning persists:

entries.response: REDUCE TO MINIMUM NECESSARY FOR FLIGHT

entries.text: IF BUBBLING, ABNORMALITIES, OR VISUAL DISTORTION IS OBSERVED:
Reduce power and descend to 10,000 ft or minimum safe altitude (if higher).
Land as soon as possible using side-slip maneuver, if necessary, to maintain visual contact with the runway.
IF NO BUBBLING, ABNORMALITIES, OR VISUAL DISTORTION IS OBSERVED:
If taxiing, stop immediately and do not turn.
If the engine is running, shut down engine.
Maintenance required before flight into known icing.
If taxiing, stop airplane in a safe location.
If cabin door secure and DOOR UNLOCKED Warning persists:
AFTER ENGINE START AND BEFORE TAKEOFF
After 30 seconds or ITT below 750°C whichever occurs first:
If OIL TEMP HIGH Warning remains:
IF TIME PERMITS, BEFORE USING OXYGEN, REMOVE ANY POTENTIALLY FLAMMABLE SUBSTANCES FROM YOUR FACE (OILS, GREASE, SOAP, LIPSTICK, MAKEUP, ETC.).

checklists.name: EXITING SEVERE ICING OR SLD CONDITIONS

entries.text: Exit the area immediately by changing altitude and/or course.
Do not re-engage the autopilot until the airframe is clear of ice.

If an unusual roll response or uncommanded control movement is observed, reduce angle of attack by increasing airspeed and/or rolling wings level (if in a turn), and apply additional power, if needed.
Avoid extending flaps during extended operations in icing conditions to reduce the possibility of ice forming on the upper surface of the wing further aft than normal.
If flaps are extended, do not retract them until the airframe is clear of ice.
Report these weather conditions to Air Traffic Control.
To acknowledge and silence EDM alert:
Do not re-engage the autopilot until the airframe is clear of ice.

If an unusual roll response or uncommanded control movement is observed, reduce angle of attack by increasing airspeed and/or rolling wings level (if in a turn), and apply additional power, if needed.
Avoid extending flaps during extended operations in icing conditions to reduce the possibility of ice forming on the upper surface of the wing further aft than normal.
If flaps are extended, do not retract them until the airframe is clear of ice.
Report these weather conditions to Air Traffic Control.
